avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger changes from low to moderate during the course of the day above 1.800 m. Danger spots are located in steep shady slopes and gullies. There spontaneous loose-snow avalanches are possible any time. On smooth surfaces gliding-snow avalanches are possible. Avoid areas below glide cracks. Avalanches are small to medium sized.8
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanche danger differs during the course of the day. Increasing spontaneous wet-snow avalanches from steep terrain in high altitudes!

snowpackStructure.comment: in high altitudes a thin surface hoar-crust could form during the night, which softens quickly during the day. the snow base is isothermal and wet or mois even in high altitudes. On southern exposed slopes the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: Monday will be changeable with few showers in the afternoon. No significant changes of the avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: After a predominantly clear night, the Easter Sunday will be sunny and mild. Only in the northern Alps some clouds are visible. Moderate southwesterly winds, in the foothills winds can be brisk. Temperatures at noon in 2.000 m are between +4 and +8 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Nevertheless danger spots are located ind very steep shady slopes. There small sized spontaneous loose-snow and wet-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Only little amount of snow, but spontaneous loose-snow avalanches from steep shady slopes are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed sloped the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: Monday will be changeable with few showers in the afternoon. No significant changes of the avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: After a predominantly clear night, the Easter Sunday will be sunny and mild. Only in the northern Alps some clouds are visible. Moderate southwesterly winds, in the foothills winds can be brisk. Temperatures at noon in 2.000 m are between +4 and +8 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Good mountain weather, in high altitudes still wet -snow problem.
